boat.full_description:
Marguerite was built in Malahide, North Dublin in 1896 by a Norwegian boat builder Johann Valenhausen who had changed his name to Jack Wellington. Designed by Herbert Boyd she is a sister to Ethna who was the prototype for the Howth 17 one design. She was replanked in 1990 and had her deck and rig replaced in 2018. She sails from the Royal Irish Yacht Club, Dun Laoghaire.

1896 - ?      Edivane Dillon and Willie Tomlinson
       - 1936 Mrs Hilda Park and Charlotte Thornhill.
1936-1947 Mungo Park;
1947-1965 Norman Chance;
1965-1967 David Sarratt; Bray, Co. Wicklow.
1967-1977 Micheal OhUallachain; Dalkey.
1977-1984 Ronnie Kavanagh;
1984-1985 Johnny McCarthy;
1986-1993 Ken Hudson; Redcross, Co. Wickow.
1993-2018 Tim Magennis; Dun Laoghaire

2017 –        Guy Kilroy;
boat.name: Marguerite
boat.short_description: Only sister of the prototype for the Howth 17, Ethine
